page.title: 17The Queen's Visit
page.content: This year on 3rd May Her Majesty The Queen paid a private visit to her lands in the Duchy of Lancaster. She drove through Podington and stopped her car to accept some flowers from Philip and Sarah. We were all very excited. We made Union Jack flags. We hung some on a piece of string and some we put on sticks and waved. The car had the Royal Standard on the front. It was a Rolls Royce. The next day I wrote a thank you letter to the Queen for accepting the flowers. I said how pretty her blue suit looked and how Prince Philip looked nice too. I waited a week. Then came an exciting day, an envelope with the royal crest on it. The Queen had written to me. The letter was from a Lady-in-Waiting. She said she had been commanded to write to me by the Queen. I have framed the letter.
